The new issue of The Journal of Intellectual Freedom and Privacy is out! This was a special issue edited by Jeanie Austin and focusing on Access to Information in Carceral Institutions. Kurtis Tanaka, PhD and I wrote a brief commentary on censorship and surveillance in higher education in prison. I think we've learned a lot since we drafted this piece, but it serves as a good, brief introduction to the issues in the field. Can't wait to dig into the other commentaries and the feature piece from Moira Marquis, PhD. Link to the full issue: https://lnkd.in/eAfKZS99 (It is paywalled and you have to be an ALA member to access, but reach out if you want to talk more about the piece that Kurtis and I wrote.)
